attributes.action: Start a petition AGAINST the petition to hold a 2nd referendum. The UK voted out
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. Citizens voted with 17,410,742 votes to LEAVE the EU.
Just short of 1,300,000 more votes than the remain campaign. This is not close but a clear win for the leave campaign.
Why are some people determined to try and not accept this fair and democratic vote? Sour grapes? Childish tantrum? just didn't believe they would lose? Your clearly out of touch with public opinion. Get over it, stop spitting your dummy out, be positive and accept we are out. We need to move forward now. We're OUT!
attributes.background: 23rd June 2016, the UK voted to leave the EU with a clear result of well over a million votes. This was democracy at its best. For the people who cannot handle this result, grow up. Everyone had a fair vote. To now try and start a petition to have a 2nd referendum is pathetic. Accept it & move on
